abstract: Regulators and exchanges are considering marketwide circuit breakers that would temporarily stop trading when it falls 5 percent, Reuters reported.
snippet: Regulators and exchanges are considering marketwide circuit breakers that would temporarily stop trading when it falls 5 percent, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: United States regulators and exchanges are considering marketwide circuit breakers that would temporarily stop trading when it falls 5 percent, Reuters reported, citing two sources familiar with the talks.

headline.main: Wider Circuit Breakers Mulled for U.S. Markets
